text: Type rules Often, we want to describe a type system using type judgements that are of the form Ere:t E is a function called a type environment which tells us the types of variables that can occur free in e. This is the type level-counterpart to the environment env that tells us the values of variables. A type judgement says that Given the type environment E, the type of e is t. The valid type judgements are given by a collection of inference rules.
